articles.title: LIVE: California Midterm Election Results 2018
articles.description: The Nexus will be updating this page with live results from the California Midterm Election and the Santa Barbara County election.
articles.content:
The Nexus will be updating this page with live results from the Nov. 6 California Midterm Election and the Santa Barbara County election. We will also be live-tweeting additional results.

Governor:

Vote by Mail and Mailed Ballot Results: Gavin Newsom (D) leads with 54.65% of the vote. His opponent, John Cox (R), trails with 45.35% of the vote as of 8:02 p.m.

  • 9:27 p.m. Newsom has 54.72%, Cox has 45.28%
  • 9:50 p.m. Newsom has 55.05%, Cox has 44.95%
  • 10:06 p.m. Newsom has 56.02%, Cox has 43.98%
  • 10:17 p.m. Newsom has 57.41%, Cox has 42.59%
  • 10:39 p.m. Newsom has 59.50%, Cox has 40.50%
  • 10:56 p.m. Newsom has 58.99%, Cox has 41.01%
  • 11:25 p.m. Newsom has 57.74%, Cox has 40.97% of the vote, with 100% of precincts now reporting.

Secretary of State:

Vote by Mail and Mailed Ballot Results: Alex Padilla (D) leads with 57.05% of the vote. His opponent, Mark Meuser (R), follows with 42.95% of the vote as of 8:02 p.m.

  • 9:27 p.m. Padilla has 57.12%, Meuser has 42.88%
  • 9:50 p.m. Padilla has 57.46%, Meuser has 42.54%
  • 10:06 p.m. Padilla has 58.40%, Meuser has 41.60%
  • 10:17 p.m. Padilla has 59.78%, Meuser has 40.22%
  • 10:39 p.m. Padilla has 61.91%, Meuser has 38.09%
  • 10:56 p.m. Padilla has 61.50%, Meuser has 38.50%
  • 11:25 p.m. Padilla has 59.60%, Meuser has 37.50% of the vote, with 100% of the precincts now reporting.

California Senator:

Vote by Mail and Mailed Ballot Results: Dianne Feinstein (D) leads with 54.87% of the vote. Her opponent, Kevin De Leon (D) trails with 45.13% of the vote as of 8:02 p.m.

  • 9:27 p.m. Feinstein has 54.94%, De Leon has 45.06%
  • 9:50 p.m. Feinstein has 55.15%, De Leon has 45.85%
  • 10:06 p.m. Feinstein has 55.36%, De Leon has 44.64%
  • 10:17 p.m. Feinstein has 55.65%, De Leon has 44.35%
  • 10:39 p.m. Feinstein has 55.78%, De Leon has 44.22%
  • 10:56 p.m. Feinstein has 55.56%, De Leon has 44.44%
  • 11:25 p.m. Feinstein has 47.58%, De Leon has 38.41% of the vote, with 100% of the precincts now reporting.

24th Congressional District (Santa Barbara and San Luis Obispo Counties) Representative:

Vote by Mail and Mailed Ballot Results: Salud Carbajal (D) leads with 55.82% of the vote. His opponent, Justin Fareed (R), follows with 44.18% of the vote as of 8:02 p.m.

  • 9:27 p.m. Carbajal has 55.89%, Fareed has 44.11%
  • 9:50 p.m. Carbajal has 56.26%, Fareed has 43.74%
  • 10:06 p.m. Carbajal has 57.21%, Fareed has 42.79%
  • 10:17 p.m. Carbajal has 58.63%, Fareed has 41.37%
  • 10:39 p.m. Carbajal has 60.77%, Fareed has 39.23%
  • 10:56 p.m. Carbajal has 60.30%, Fareed has 39.70%
  • 11:25 p.m. Carbajal has 58.96%, Fareed has 39.58% of the vote, with 100% of the precincts reported

State Assembly 37th District Representative:

Vote by Mail and Mailed Ballot Results: Monique Limón (D) leads with 82.84%. Her opponent, David Norrdin (D), follows with 17.16% of the vote.

  • 9:27 p.m. Limón has 82.86%, Norrdin has 17.14%
  • 9:50 p.m. Limón has 82.88%, Norrdin has 17.12%
  • 10:06 p.m. Limón has 83.18%, Norrdin has 16.82%
  • 10:17 p.m. Limón has 83.68%, Norrdin has 16.32%
  • 10:39 p.m. Limón has 84.29%, Norrdin has 15.71%
  • 10:56 p.m. Limón has 84.03%, Norrdin has 15.97%
  • 11:25 p.m. Limón has 67.23%, Norrdin has 13.03% of the vote, with 100% of precincts now reporting.

Goleta Union School District:

Vote by Mail and Mailed Ballot Results: Luz Reyes-Martin leads with 32.18% of the vote. Her opponents follow with 30.63% of the vote (Richard Mayer), 25.16% of the vote (Carin Ezal), 11.31% of the vote (Bruce Wallach.)

  • 9:27 p.m. Reyes-Martin has 32.18%, Mayer has 30.63%, Ezal has 25.16% and Wallach has 11.31%
  • 9:50 p.m. Reyes-Martin has 32.25%, Mayer has 30.59%, Ezal has 25.09% and Wallach has 11.35%
  • 10:06 p.m. Reyes-Martin has 32.64%, Mayer has 30.29%, Ezal has 24.86% and Wallach has 11.53%
  • 10:17 p.m. Reyes-Martin has 33.19%, Mayer has 29.96%, Ezal has 24.70% and Wallach has 11.51%
  • 10:39 p.m. Reyes-Martin has 33.84%, Mayer has 29.73%, Ezal has 24.09% and Wallach has 11.69%
  • 10:39 p.m. Reyes-Martin has 33.90%, Mayer has 29.70%, Ezal has 24.09% and Wallach has 11.65%
  • 11:25 p.m. Reyes-Martin has 54.73%, Mayer has 47.55%, Ezal has 38.79% and Wallach has 18.71% of the vote, with 100% of precincts now reporting.

Ballot Measures:

Measure G2018 (Re-Districting Initiative) County Ordinance:

Vote by Mail and Mailed Ballot Results: 48.53% no, 51.47% yes

  • 9:27 p.m. 51.51% yes, 48.45% no
  • 9:50 p.m. 51.82% yes, 48.18% no
  • 10:06 p.m. 52.31% yes, 47.69% no
  • 10:17 p.m. 53.09% yes, 46.91% no
  • 10:39 p.m. 54.20% yes, 45.80% no
  • 10:56 p.m. 53.76% yes, 46.24% no
  • 11:25 p.m. 46.42% yes, 41.19% no, with 100% of precincts now reporting.

Measure H2018 (Re-Districting Initiative) County Initiative:

Vote by Mail and Mailed Ballot Results: 68.24% no, 31.76% yes

  • 9:27 p.m. 68.24% no, 31.76% yes
  • 9:50 p.m. 68.27% no, 31.73% yes
  • 10:06 p.m. 68.23% no, 31.77% yes
  • 10:17 p.m. 68.06% no, 31.94% yes
  • 10:39 p.m. 67.88% no, 32.12% yes
  • 10:56 p.m. 67.61% no, 32.39% yes
  • 11:25 p.m. 57.12% no, 27.65% yes, with 100% of precincts now reporting.

Measure Z2018 City Goleta Cannabis Tax:

Vote by Mail and Mailed Ballot Results: 83.33% yes, 16.67% no

  • 9:27 p.m. 83.33% yes, 16.67% no
  • 9:50 p.m. 83.34% yes, 16.66% no
  • 10:06 p.m. 83.34% yes, 16.66% no
  • 10:17 p.m. 82.99% yes, 17.01% no
  • 10:39 p.m. 82.34% yes, 17.66% no
  • 10:56 p.m. 81.95% yes, 18.05% no
  • 11:25 p.m. 77.76% yes, 17.16% no, with 100% of precincts now reporting.

articles.title: Vista Point: Weekly Goings-On in Isla Vista
articles.description: Little excerpts of events happening around Isla Vista this week; go out, join your neighbors, and have fun!
articles.content:
Sierra Deak / Daily Nexus

Fun Films!

In following with true Halloween spirit, Associated Students (A.S.) Program Board is playing “The First Purge” at Isla Vista Theater this Tuesday. The show times are at 7 p.m. and 10 p.m. and admission is free for students with presentation of an access card. This movie is guaranteed to bring both fright and fun to this Halloween season, so grab your friends and spend a spooky evening with fellow students.

~Delirium~

It’s that time of year again Gauchos! A.S. Program Board’s Delirium is back, and Young Thug is the headliner for this SOLD OUT show. The performance is at the Thunderdome, and doors open at 8:30 p.m. Social House will kick off the night at 9 p.m, so be sure to get there early to get a good spot. The show is for UCSB students only, so bring your access card with you for entrance. Come ready for a night full of great music and good vibes.

Come Shop Pop-Up!

Have you ever looked in your closet and felt as though you needed new clothes? Or, better yet, new-to-you clothes? If so, you’re in luck! Lazy Eye Pop-Up Shop is coming to I.V. on Saturday from 12 p.m. to 4 p.m. at the Isla Vista Food Co-Op. Andi Modugno, a Santa-Barbara-based clothing collector is bringing her assortment of clothes, shoes and accessories. Modugno attempts to reduce people’s ecological footprints by promoting the sale of upcycled articles. Come show your support for the environment and local businesses by stopping by the Co-Op to check out some unique and eclectic pieces of clothing!

Fair Trade Chocolate Tasting

The I.V. Co-Op will be promoting fair trade, ethically traded and directly traded chocolate by giving out free samples of Theo Chocolate, Alter Eco and Equal Exchange products. This tasty fest is happening this Tuesday from 5 p.m. to 7 p.m. at 6575 Seville Rd. You will not want to miss this sweet event!

Bark, Bark, Bark

The Isla Vista Recreation and Parks District is offering free dog training in I.V. every Sunday at 11 a.m. Drop by with your little fluffy pal to teach them a few tricks. The newly-opened dog park is located on 6650 Sueno Rd. The trainer, Jill Atamian Hall, is an experienced dog trainer from Santa Barbara. Dogs will learn commands including sit, stay, come and place. Harnesses and four- to six-foot leashes are required equipment for the class. Flexi-leashes, prong collars and e-collars are not allowed. The class is first come first serve, so show up early and come prepared!

Print

articles.title: Vista Point: Weekly Goings-On in Isla Vista
articles.description: Little excerpts of events happening around Isla Vista this week; go out, join your neighbors, and have fun!
articles.content:
Sierra Deak / Daily Nexus

Pass the Mic!

Speak your voice and express inner creativity at this open mic night hosted in collaboration by KCSB-FM and the Isla Vista Food Co-op. From 6 p.m. to 9 p.m. this Saturday, all ages are welcome to present new works, old favorites and everything in between in front of friends and community members of I.V. If you feel like signing up early, you can email promotion@kcsb.org to get your name on the top of the list.

Fun and Festivities

The I.V. Open Market returns to Little Acorn Park to offer the community an open-air vendor market featuring local student artists and creators. Browse and buy everything from vintage clothing and jewelry to collectibles and artwork from 11 a.m. to 3 p.m. this Saturday. Grab your friends and head down to the park to enjoy the good weather and fun festivities.

Furry Friends

We all know I.V. is home to some of the cutest doggos in existence. Even so, sometimes they still need a little help knowing how to behave. If you know a dog like this, bring that pupper on down to this free training event for dogs and dog owners in I.V. Certified dog trainer Jill Atamian Hall will lead this one-hour session from 11 a.m. to 12 p.m. this Sunday at 6650 Sueno Rd. Take advantage of I.V.’s free services and give that dog some guidance.

Nightmare on Sueno

Get ready to rock before the noise ordinances start! This Friday, Isla Vista’s own Noise Complaint and Odd Army are performing back-to-back for a Nightmare on Sueno concert on 6666 Sueno Rd. Odd Army will be starting the night off with a performance from 9:30 p.m. to 10:20 p.m., followed by Noise Complaint, who will be bringing the house down from 10:30 p.m. to 12 a.m. Come dressed up in your Halloween costume and be prepared for a night of dancing, great music, chills and thrills!

Clean Up, BEACHES!

This Sunday, UCSB’s Health Environment Animal Rights (H.E.A.R.) organization is hosting a beach cleanup at Sands Beach at Coal Oil Point from 12 p.m. to 2 p.m. Materials will be provided by the club, and it is encouraged that you bring your friends! The cleanup crew will be meeting by the bike racks above Sands Beach and will reconvene after the event for a free picnic put on by H.E.A.R.! There is no better way to spend a sunny Sunday than to go to the beach and give back to your community, so come on out to Sands Beach for an afternoon of fun!

Free Films

A.S. Program Board proudly presents Free Tuesday Films of Fall 2018! This Tuesday they are showing “Mission: Impossible – Fallout” at 7 p.m. and 10 p.m. Showings are held at I.V. Theater at 960 Embarcadero Del Norte. UC Santa Barbara ACCESS Cards are required for entry. Bring a friend and be prepared for a night of excitement and incredible stunts by Tom Cruise.

Print

articles.title: Vista Point: Weekly Goings-On in Isla Vista
articles.description: Little excerpts of events happening around Isla Vista this week; go out, join your neighbors, and have fun!
articles.content:
Sierra Deak / Daily Nexus

International Hour at Woodstock’s Pizza

International Hour happens every Thursday from 4 p.m. to 5 p.m. at Woodstock’s Pizza! Come hang out with international students and members of the Office of International Students and Scholars. If you get to the event early enough, you’ll get a piece of Woodstock’s Wildebread, but otherwise you have the option to order pizza and a pitcher of beer. Don’t even worry about RSVP’ing, just swing on by!

Shopping on a Budget

Are you wondering about how to eat well while still having enough money in your bank account? Come to the Isla Vista Vista Food Co-Op from 4 p.m. to 5 p.m. on Thursday, Oct. 10 to learn about shopping on a budget! The Co-Op will be providing an interactive meal that you’ll be able to take home, and that affordable meal will be made based on affordable shopping methods – bring your friends! Free snacks will be provided. There will be a raffle as well, and you’ll have a chance to win a copy of Good and Cheap: Eat Well on a $4/Day by Leanne Brown.

Think Pink

In honor of breast cancer awareness month, celebrate with a four course all pink meal hosted by Chabad UCSB and Sharsheret this Friday at 7:30 p.m at 779 Camino Pescadero. Participants will also have the chance to hear from a breast cancer survivor.

Fair Trade Coffee Break and Banana Bread

What better way to kick off the start of fall than to taste fresh coffee and chocolate chip banana bread with your friends at the Co-Op! Allison, the Sustainability Coordinator at the Co-Op, will be giving a talk about the different Fair Trade Organizations that the Co-Op supports. This tasty and informational event is Friday from 11 a.m. to 1 p.m. at 6575 Seville Rd. Come by and show your support for food and fair business!

Deadpool 2 Screening!

Still bummed about missing out on the premiere of Deadpool 2 at UC Santa Barbara last year? You’ll have another opportunity to see the movie this weekend at Script to Screen: Deadpool 2 at Pollock Theater on Saturday at 2 p.m. Screenwriters and Executive Producers of the movie Rhett Reese and Paul Wernick will be there for a post-screening discussion of the movie. Tickets are $5 for students and $7 for community members, but you can use the coupon code “Facebook” to get 20% off your ticket.

Pardall Carnival

Join your fellow Isla Vistans at the annual Pardall Carnival and Meet Your Neighbor Day this upcoming Saturday. Vendors and organizations will line the street where people will gather from 12 p.m. to 4 p.m. Take a break from studying and stop by with friends and get to know the tight-knit community of Isla Vista. Speaking of, the Daily Nexus will have a booth, so do not forget to stop by and say hey – We’d love to meet you!

KCSB-FM Meet Your Neighbor Day

Do you like music? Community? Free food? Are you interested in getting involved with one of the most eclectic and chill organizations on campus? If the answer is yes to any of these, then stop by Anisq’oyo Park at 966 Embarcadero del Mar on Saturday for a KCSB Meet your Neighbor Day! This fun filled event will begin with a free pancake breakfast from 9:30 a.m. to 11:30 a.m. Then, there will be performances by Serpent Season and Jack Kilgore from 11:30 a.m. to 3 p.m. Special appearances by KCSB’s very own DJs, The Crypt Keeper and Alla. You won’t want to miss out on this unforgettable afternoon!

Print

articles.title: Daily Nexus Crime Map
articles.description: The Nexus news team will be updating this map daily.
articles.content:
Below is a crime log built for the Isla Vista and UC Santa Barbara communities. The points on the map show where an individual has been arrested for a crime, along with their age, school affiliation (if applicable), city of residence and what they were arrested for.

The Nexus news team will be updating this map daily. Any questions about our reporting methods or about the map can be addressed to news@dailynexus.com.

Additional note: It is Nexus policy to check if any college-aged individuals who are arrested are students at either UCSB or SBCC.

KEY:
Purple points: September
Orange points: October

articles.title: Vista Point: Weekly Goings-On in Isla Vista
articles.description: Little excerpts of events happening around Isla Vista this week; go out, join your neighbors, and have fun!
articles.content:
Sierra Deak / Daily Nexus

Careless Cub and No Beef Crew

If you’ve missed Isla Vista’s lively music scene during the summer, the wait is over because I.V. bands Careless Cub and No Beef Crew will come together this Friday night, Sept. 29 at 8:30 p.m. for a collaborative concert. Stop by 6782 Pasado Road to rock out to some great tunes and get back into the groove of I.V.’s local band scene.

Welcome Back Concert!

Nothing says “welcome back” like a DJ set by Cuco, so stop by Storke Plaza on campus this Saturday, Sept. 29 at 8:00 p.m. for a show to kick off the new school year. Bring your friends and put your academic-related worries aside –– this will be a night of fun and good vibes! Get your school year started right!

Blast from the Past Bash

I.V.’s own St. George Youth Center is celebrating their 20th anniversary this Saturday, Sept. 29, with a 90s themed throwback party! The event will begin with an open house at the Center from 2:00 p.m. to 4:00 p.m. All ages are welcome to tour the facility that reopened to its permanent location at 889 Camino Del Sur. For anyone 21 and over, there will be a 90s themed party at the Mosher Alumni House from 6:30 p.m. to 10:00 p.m. following the facility tour. Tickets can be purchased at the St. George Youth Center for $19.98 prior to the event. Come out and support local I.V. youth and have a great night filled with 90s music.

Zest Fest

Come out to the 27th Annual California Lemon Festival, one of the largest celebrations in Goleta, this Saturday, Sept. 29, and Sunday, Sept. 30! The festival will be going on from 10:00 a.m. to 6:00 p.m. on Saturday and from 10:00 a.m. to 5:00 p.m. on Sunday at 7050 Phelps Rd. in Goleta. In addition to lemon-flavored food, pie eating contests, live music and performances, the festival will be showcasing a classic car show featuring camaros, pickup trucks, corvettes and more! Ciders, lemonade, cakes, cinnabread, ice cream, cotton candy and other treats will be present as well, so stop by the Lemon Festival for the most flavorful weekend of the year!

Print

articles.title: Vista Point: Weekly Goings-On in Isla Vista
articles.description: Little excerpts of events happening around Isla Vista this week; go out, join your neighbors, and have fun!
articles.content:
Sierra Deak / Daily Nexus

YOUR FAVORITE WORD ~ FREE ~ I.V.’S FREE ACTIVITY DAY!

Join I.V’s Food Co-op for some fresh air and free activities on Saturday, Sep. 22 at 11:30 a.m. to 2:00 p.m. The activities are hosted by the Sunflower Kid’s youth group, and are usually held every third Saturday of the month. Go outside feel to like a kid again and play games like musical chairs, create a DIY essential oil spray to calm your stressed mind during finals and sample some of the Co-op’s snacks (free food!). You can also get a $10 off shopping coupon to use (yay, more free food!). The Co-op is located at 6575 Seville Rd.

LAZY EYE SHOP POP-UP 

I.V.’s Food Co-op will be holding another Lazy Eye Shop Pop-up on Saturday. The Co-op invites customers to browse a selection of vintage clothing, accessories and shoes. All items are hand-picked by Santa Barbara collector Andi Modugno, so if you’re interested in vintage clothing, see if you can find some new outfits! The pop-up will open at 12 p.m. and will close at around 4 p.m.

RUN FOR LEMONS

The shouting of aspiring racers and supports will fill the air at Goleta Beach on Sunday as the annual Lemon Run commences, hosted by the Goleta Education Foundation. Watch competitors participate in competitive 10k and 5k races to raise money for Goleta Elementary Schools’ educators. Enjoy prizes and goodies, along with bites from Wahoo’s Fish Tacos.

FOOTBALL SEASON HAS RETURNED 

Gather with fellow fans and foes and head down to Woodstock’s Pizza in I.V. to watch the NHL game this Sunday, Sept. 23 at 10:00 a.m. Woodstock’s will be serving up all-you-can-eat cheese and pepperoni pizza slices from 10 a.m. to 3 p.m. for only $8.95. Take advantage of half-priced pitchers for happy hour during the game. Season passes are also available for Woodstock’s frequent flyers, who can win prizes and get deals during the games. Cheer on your favorite team, trash your rivals and enjoy watching the game with your friends!

BOUNCE IT

Santa Barbara Hillel, located on 781 Embarcadero del Mar in Isla Vista, will be holding a bounce house party on Monday to celebrate the beginning of another school year. Starting at 6 p.m. Hillel will be serving up root beer floats alongside a sundae bar. Grab some friends and take an evening to enjoy the last weekend before the start of school.

GET HEALTHY WITH ORGANIC FRUIT

The I.V. Co-op will be be holding a fruit tasting session on Tuesday, Sep. 25 to celebrate the end of summer, when fruits are often at their ripest. A wide array of different fruit will be available, all of which have been selected by the Co-op’s produce crew. All fruit is unsprayed and organic. The tasting will begin at 4 p.m. and last until approximately 6 p.m.

A version of this article appeared on p.3 of the Sept. 20 print edition of the Daily Nexus.

Print

articles.title: LIVE: Santa Barbara County Election Results 2018
articles.description: The Nexus will be updating this page with live results from the California Primary Election and the Santa Barbara County election.
articles.content:
The Nexus will be updating this page with live results from the California Primary Election and the Santa Barbara County election. We will also be live-tweeting additional results.

Further information regarding ballot measures relating to Isla Vista, measures T and R, can be found here and here.

Governor:

Vote by Mail and Mailed Ballot Results: Gavin Newsom leads with 34.47% of the vote

  • 9:20 p.m. Newsom leads with 34.46% of the vote, John H. Cox and Travis Allen follow with 27.00% and 12.86% respectively.
  • 10:30 p.m. Newsom leads with 35.48% of the vote, Cox follows with 25.27%, and Antonio Villaraigosa has overtaken Allen for third place with 11.92% of the vote.
  • As of 11:35 p.m., Newsom wins with 34.03% of the vote in Santa Barbara County. He will be facing off against Cox, who won 26.65% of the vote, in the November election, according to the semi-official election night results.

State Senator:

Vote By Mail and Mailed Ballot Results: Dianne Feinstein leads with 45.51% of the vote.

  • 9:05 p.m. Feinstein leads with 45.51% and James P. Bradley follows with 13.34%.
  • As of 11:35 p.m., Feinstein wins with 45.57% of the vote in Santa Barbara County, according to the semi-official election night results. Her competitor for the November election has not yet been determined.

Congressman:

Vote By Mail and Mailed Ballot Results: Salud Carbajal leads with 52.62% of the vote

  • 9:05 p.m. Carbajal leads with 52.73% of the vote, Justin Fareed follows with 38.22%, and Michael Erin Woody trails with 8.91%.
  • 9:58 p.m. Carbajal leads with 55.62% of the vote, Fareed and Woody follow with 35.86% and 8.39% of the votes.
  • 11:35 p.m. Carbajal earned 54.87% of the vote and Fareed follows with 36.74% of the vote, according to semi-official election night results. The two will be facing off in the November election for the position of U.S. Representative for the 24th District.

Santa Barbara County Sheriff-Coroner:

Vote by Mail and Mailed Ballot Results: Bill Brown leads with 55.94% of the vote, Brian Olmstead and Eddie Hsueh have 31.20% and 12.69% of the votes respectively.

  • 9:05 p.m. Brown leads with 55.89% of the vote, Olmstead has 31.15% of the vote, and Hsueh has 12.79% of the vote.
  • 9:45 p.m. Brown has 55.34% of the vote, Olmstead has 34.49%, and Hsueh has 14.00%.
  • 10:30 p.m. Brown has 54.66% of the vote, Olmstead has 30.07%, and Hsueh has 15.08%.
  • 11:35 p.m. Brown wins with 54.01% of the vote, according to semi-official election night results.

Ballot Measures:

Measure T:

Vote By Mail and Mailed Ballot Results: 76.55% yes, 23.45% no

  • 9:05 p.m. 76.53% yes, 23.47%
  • 11:35 p.m., Measure T passes with 75.73% yes votes and 24.27% no votes.

Measure R:

Vote By Mail and Mailed Ballot Results: 56.34% yes, 43.66% no

  • 9:24 p.m. 71.04% yes, 28.96% no
  • 9:35 p.m. 76.36% yes, 23.64% no
  • 9:45 p.m. 80.22% yes, 19.78% no
  • 9:58 p.m. With 10 out of 10 of Isla Vista’s precincts reporting, Measure R passes with 82.75% yes votes and 17.25% no votes.
Print

articles.title: Vista Point: Freebies and Activities in Isla Vista
articles.description: The UCSB campus group Improvability is hosting a 24-hour Improvathon from 8 p.m. on Friday to 8 p.m. on Saturday.
articles.content:
Sierra Deak / Daily Nexus

Improvability

The UCSB campus group Improvability is hosting a 24-hour Improvathon from 8 p.m. on Friday to 8 p.m. on Saturday. The marathon includes over 20 segments throughout the show and audience members who stay the full 24 hours will win a free lifetime pass to all future improv shows hosted by Improvability. Food and drinks will be provided for the audience, but Improvability also recommends that attendees bring pillows, sleeping bags and chargers to make themselves more comfortable during the show. Come by Embarcadero Hall in I.V. to support these student comedians!

 

Togapalooza

The epitome of stereotypical college parties is returning to Isla Vista for the sixth time this Saturday. Get ready to dress yourself in bedsheets and fake flower crowns and head over to 850 Camino Lindo for Togapalooza. Over ten bands will be playing throughout this 12-hour rager, including a handful of local I.V. bands such as punk band RabbitFoot, rock band The Mallards and The Anti-Sheist. The party will kick off at 12 p.m. and a skateboarding competition will take place at 3 p.m., commenced by the band Foghorns.

 

Last First Friday

It’s the last first Friday of the school-year! UCSB’s Inter-Greek Council is hosting their monthly I.V. First Friday event once again, this Friday from 9 p.m. to 11 p.m. DJ BJ, DJ Josh K and DJ Dom will be performing at the event in People’s Park where there will also be hot dogs and shaved ice available for purchase. Proceeds from the food sales will be donated to Associated Students Food Bank.

 

Bust a Move

This Saturday is the fourth annual Day of Movement, held at Isla Vista Elementary School. The event is from 12 p.m. to 5 p.m. and is hosted by the nonprofit organization Everybody Dance Now! (EDN!). This event aims to bring together the local community through dance. Freestyle dance competitions will be held during the event with a cash prize of $200 for winners. The event will also include a free family dance class and end with the EDN! Spring Recital.

 

Frisson’s *for now* Finale

Local indie rock band Frisson will be performing their last show this Friday and they’re inviting I.V. to join them in their apocalypse-themed finale. KCHO is starting the show at 9:30 p.m. followed by Frisson at 10:30 p.m. Stop by 6794 Trigo Road this Friday night for your last chance to see Frisson.

 

Bike, Beach, BBQ

National Bike Month is coming to a close and in celebration, UCSB Sustainability, CycleMAYnia and McConnell’s Fine Ice Cream are teaming up for Bike to Goleta Beach BBQ, an event with $2 tacos, free ice cream, fun beach games and competitions, music, friends and cycling. CycleMAYnia will also be handing out awards for the Bike Challenge competition. The event will happen Thursday from 4:30 p.m. to 6:30 p.m. at Goleta Beach.

A version of this article appeared on p.3 of the May 30 print edition of the Daily Nexus.

Print

articles.title: Vista Point
articles.description: Catch the goings-on in Isla Vista this week!
articles.content:
Sierra Deak / Daily Nexus

Keep it Lit

Have you ever walked around Isla Vista at night and noticed the deteriorating lighting fixtures? Have you ever wondered what you can do to help fix this pressing issue? If so, you’re in luck! The Isla Vista Community Service District is inviting people to come out to its office on Tuesday at 8 p.m. to inspect the street lights around I.V. Volunteers will be partnered up and assigned a street block to walk down and assess lighting issues. Free dinner will be provided to all participants, so drop by and do your part to serve your community!

Delta Cakes Take Two

Tri-Delta is hosting an all-you-can-eat pancake fundraiser on Thursday from 5:30 p.m. to 8:30 p.m. at its chapter house. The event is being held to raise money for St. Jude’s Children’s Hospital to provide help for children with rare medical diseases. Tickets are $5 presale and $7 at the door. Stop by 6547 Cordoba Rd. for a sweet time and tasty cakes!

Town Hall Time

The Santa Barbara Sheriff’s Department is holding a public forum Thursday from 7 p.m. to 8:30 p.m. in the I.V. Community room. Candidates running for Santa Barbara County Sheriff will be in attendance to share their platforms regarding how they plan to make I.V. safer for everyone. Audience members will have the opportunity at the end to ask each candidate any questions they may have. Free food will be provided for all attendees! Stop by and make your voice heard.

Friends, Films and Fun

Looking for new movies to add to your queue? Want an excuse to dress up for a night? I.V. Film Festival is hosting a movie-showing on Saturday from 6 p.m. to 9 p.m. at 6616 Sabado Tarde. The featured films were created by I.V. community members in an attempt to showcase their own separate passions. Formal attire is required and good times are guaranteed!

Grunge and Green

Isla Vista’s own alternative rock band The Mallards are teaming up with Odd Army for a night of great music on Saturday from 9 p.m. to 12 a.m. Odd Army will be playing a series of Red Hot Chili Peppers cover songs, and the theme is green out. So bring some friends to 6508 Del Playa and get ready for a night of sick music, free refreshments and lots of green.

Black Panther

A.S. Program Board will be showing Black Panther on Tuesday, May 29 at I.V. Theater at 7 p.m. and 10 p.m. The movie, one of many set within the Marvel Cinematic Universe, stars Chadwick Boseman as Black Panther, Michael B. Jordan as Erik Killmonger, Lupita Nyong’o as Nakia, Danai Gurira as Okoye and Letitia Wright as Shuri. Valid UCSB Access Cards are required for entry.

Cheese Tray Tasting!

The I.V. Food Co-op will be holding a sustainable cheese tray testing Thursday from 3 p.m. to 5 p.m. Attendees will learn how to create their own seasonal cheese tray using local fruits, spreads, nuts and three different kinds of the co-op’s sustainable cheeses, including plant-based cheese. The co-op is located at 6575 Seville Rd, so come and learn how to make your own cheese tray!

A version of this article appeared on pg. 3 of the May 24, 2018 issue of the Daily Nexus.

Print

articles.title: Vista Point
articles.description: Come see what's happening in I.V. this week!
articles.content:
Sierra Deak / Daily Nexus

PROTECT YOUR MOTHER

Are you interested in protecting the environment and learning about the consequences of human effects on earth’s resources? If so, come to Bren Hall 1414 on Friday from 12 p.m. to 2 p.m. to watch a free screening of the film “Protect” and engage in a discussion with a number of environmental advocates including members of the Chumash Tribe. The event is hosted by the Santa Barbara Standing Rock Coalition and will inform students on efforts to protect land, water and air resources.

INTO INDUS

Indus, UC Santa Barbara’s South Asian Cultural Organization, is hosting a showcase Friday from 6:30 p.m. to 9:30 p.m in Campbell Hall. The showcase is called Vision and will include a plethora of performances of the South Asian culture, including Bollywood, Bhangra and a fashion show. Samosas will be available for sale during intermission and admittance is free for everyone. Come out Friday to support Indus!

WORD UP! 

WORD Magazine is holding their annual music and arts festival this Saturday, May 19 from 1 p.m. to 3 p.m. at Rincon Brewery in I.V. The festival will include live performances from Odd Army at 1 p.m., funk, hip-hop and rock ‘n’ roll band Backwood Bishops at 1:40 p.m. and indie rock band Frisson at 2:20 p.m. There will also be tie-dye stations, henna artists, face painters and artists from WORD Magazine drawing caricatures. And on top of all that, the event is free!

BEACH BASH 

The Institute of Electrical and Electronics Engineers Student Branch at UCSB is hosting their annual end of the year beach BBQ Saturday from 11 a.m. to 1 p.m. at Goleta Beach. There will be hot dogs and frisbees as students are able to celebrate the school year coming to a close. RSVP on Facebook by noon on Friday, May 18 to attend.

BROS AND BALLADS

UCSB’s all male a capella group, Brothas from Otha Mothas, are hosting their prom-themed spring concert Saturday from 8 p.m. to 10 p.m. in I.V. Theater. They will be performing covers of songs as well as doing a senior dance. Tickets are $5 at the door or $4.50 using the link on BFOM’s Spring Concert Facebook Page.

EXTRAVAGANZA

One of A.S. Program Board’s most anticipated events is happening this Sunday, May 20 from 1 p.m. to 6 pm. Extravaganza’s 2018 lineup includes DJ Dillon Francis as the headliner, Charli XCX, DRAM and Coast Modern. Vendors in the stadium will also be selling food. Stop by the Harder Stadium in Isla Vista this weekend!

FREE FILMS

A.S. Program Board is presenting a free showing of “Game Night” in I.V. Theater on Tuesday from 6 p.m. to 9 p.m. This hilariously funny and action-packed movie follows a night in the life of Max (Jason Bateman) and Annie (Rachel McAdams), a game-loving couple who get unsuspectedly involved in a real-life mystery they believe to be a part of an intricate game night.

DELTACAKES

If the sound of all-you-can-eat pancakes makes your mouth water, be sure to attend Tri Delta’s House of Pancake charity event. On Wednesday, May 23, there will be unlimited pancakes at the Tri Delta chapter house on 6547 Cordoba Road for people who purchase tickets which are $7 at the door or $5 for presale. All proceeds will be donated to St. Jude Children’s Research Hospital.

A version of this article appeared on pg. 3 of the May 17, 2018 issue of the Daily Nexus.

Print

articles.title: Vista Point
articles.description: Check out this week's freebies and activities in Isla Vista.
articles.content:
Sierra Deak / Daily Nexus

SURF AND SUNSHINE

Isla Vista Surfrider will host its 19th annual Concert for the Coast on Saturday from 12 p.m. to 7 p.m. at Anisq’Oyo Park. The event is free for all ages and will feature musical artists including Cydeways, Pookie and Matt Perko and Friends. The music will be accompanied by a variety of local vendors and organizations, including Santa Barbara Woodfire Catering, Isla Vista Trading Post and Spindtseaglass Jewelry. The event also includes a raffle with prizes such as Slightly Stoopid tickets or a Patagonia wetsuit. A fundraiser will be held at Woodstock’s Pizza in Isla Vista from 1 p.m. to 7 p.m. and the proceeds will be donated to the Environmental Defense Center.

 

GROOVY GARAGE

This Friday, prepare to swap your crop tops and button downs for tie-dye shirts and bell-bottom pants. Le Garage in Isla Vista is hosting a groovy house show for party-goers to enjoy some local bands. Kicking off the show at 9 p.m. is rock band Idle Riot, follow by Coffin at 10 p.m. and rock band Odd Army at 11 p.m. Stop by 6775 Sueno Road for some ’70s fun.

 

CLEAN UP, CLEAN UP, EVERYBODY CLEAN UP!

Isla Vista Surfrider is hosting a beach cleanup at Campus Point on Sunday from 12 p.m. to 2 p.m. Adopt-A-Block at the Isla Vista Recreation and Parks District will provide equipment to all participants. Come and give back to I.V. by keeping the beaches clean!

 

BAKED

For those of you who are “baking inclined,” the Isla Vista Food Co-op’s Spring Bake Off on Friday, May 11, from 4 p.m. to 7 p.m. provides to perfect opportunity to show off your skills in the kitchen. Bakers’ creations will be judged on a set of three categories, which includes “Most Creative,” “Best Vegan Dessert” and “Top Choice.” Participating bakers will receive a $5 Co-Op gift card and the top three winners will receive $30 Co-Op gift cards. Those who prefer tasting to baking can participate as a judge in the contest and vote for their favorite desserts for each category. This bake-off takes place at the Co-op at 6575 Seville Road.

 

YERBA, CHEETOS AND FABULOUS MUSIC

Come to Storke Plaza on Thursday for free Yerba Mate drinks, Flaming Hot Cheetos and fabulous music by Clairo hosted by the A.S. Program Board. The performance will happen from 12 p.m. to 1 p.m. This 19 year old singer/songwriter based in Boston is scheduled to perform at Blurry Vision and will go on tour with Dua Lipa! She has opened for Tyler, the Creator, BROCKHAMPTON, Steve Lacy and TACO in L.A. Swing by for some awesome music and good vibes.

 

LORD OF THE RINGS, RINGS, RINGS

Magic Lanterns Films will be hold a Lord of the Rings trilogy on Friday, from 7 p.m. to 7 a.m. The films, directed by Peter Jackson, feature Orlando Bloom, Elijah Wood and Ian McKellen as they travel around Middle Earth. The first movie, titled “The Lord of the Rings: The Fellowship of the Ring,” earned $871.5 million when it was in the box office in 2001 and adapts J. R. R. Tolkien’s trilogy of classic fantasy novels.

 

MOVIE MONDAY!

Magic Lantern Films will be showing a double feature on Monday night: “Call Me By Your Name” at 7 p.m. and “It” at 10 p.m. “It” takes a darker turn within the horror genre, focusing on a clown who taunts several outcasts during one horrifying summer. “Call Me By Your Name” takes a light turn, featuring Armie Hammer and Timothée Chalamet as Oliver and Elio, respectively as the two develop a romantic relationship over the course of a summer in Italy.

A version of this article appeared on p.3 of the May 10 print edition of the Daily Nexus.

Print

articles.title: Vista Point
articles.description: Check out the goings-on in Isla Vista this week!
articles.content:
Sierra Deak / Daily Nexus

MAY THE FOURTH BE WITH YOU

Alternative rock band The Mallards returns to “the pond” to play a Star Wars-themed show on Friday, May 4. Attendees are encouraged to come dressed as their favorite Star Wars character. Indie rock band Frission will be opening the show at 9 p.m., with The Mallards playing from 10:30 p.m. to 12 a.m. at 6508 Del Playa Drive.

BREWERY BEATS

Ventura-based band Noble Grizwald will be playing at Rincon Brewery in Isla Vista on Saturday for the first time. The self-described funk/folk/bluegrass/rock band brings an eclectic, upbeat, surf-rock sound to their shows and their blend of genres guarantees variety in every song. Stop by the Rincon Brewery anywhere between 7 p.m. to 9 p.m. to catch the band laying down some fun tracks.

HIIT

Fitness professional Rhian Jacques will be holding High Intensity Interval Training (HIIT) on Monday at 2 p.m. at the Pardall Center in I.V. The classes run a high-energy workout and typically involve a combination of aerobics and body weight exercises for toning. For example, participants will do squats, push-ups, sit-ups, planks, mountain climbers, tricep dips and burpees. At the end of the workout, participants will get a free Blenders smoothie! Everyone is welcome to attend. Pardall Center is located at 6550 Pardall Road.

DROP THE MIC

UC Santa Barbara’s Poets’ Club will be holding an open mic at Coffee Collaborative on Thursday night, located at 6560 Pardall Road. Musicians, comedians, spoken word artists, jugglers and more are all welcome to come and perform. This is the group’s first open mic of the quarter. The open mic will last from 8 p.m. to 10 p.m.

BENEFIT SHOW

Sigma Phi Epsilon is holding their annual benefit show on Friday at 795 Embarcadero del Norte. Four different musical artists of various genres will be performing including Stranger Than Fiction, I.V.-based band The Anti-Sheist, West Swell hailing from South Bay of Los Angeles and DJ Microsoft Paint ‘98. Tickets will be $10. Participants can Venmo @UCSB-SigEp. The lineup will begin at 7:45 p.m. with Stranger than Fiction and will continue until 11:59 p.m. All proceeds will go to the Juvenile Diabetes Research Foundation.

BREAK A SWEAT

Santa Barbara Krav Maga will be holding cardio and self-defense classes at the A.S. Pardall Center, located at 6550 Pardall Rd. Classes will include striking and kicking drills, circuit training, strength training and resistance work. Everyone is welcome and free Blenders will be provided to all the participants. All levels are welcome. Classes will be held every Tuesday at 5 p.m. until June 12.

MY CUP OF TEA

On Friday from 3 p.m. to 5 p.m., the Isla Vista Food Cooperative will be hosting a Japanese Tea Workshop. Bring your friends and learn about how to prepare and serve the Co-Op’s selection of Japanese Green Tea. This is a fun and relaxing way to end a stressful week full of studying for midterms. The workshop will be located on the patio of the Co-Op.

A version of this article appeared on pg. 3 of the May 3, 2018 issue of the Daily Nexus.

Print

articles.title: LIVE: A.S. Election Results 2018
articles.description: The Nexus will be updating this page with live results from the Associated Students Election, which will be announced at The Hub in the UCen beginning at 8 p.m.
articles.content:
The Nexus will be updating this page with live results from the Associated Students Election, which will be announced at The Hub in the UCen beginning at 8 p.m.

Profiles of all 52 A.S. candidates can be found here.

President: Brooke Kopel (Campus United)

Internal Vice President: Steven Ho (Isla Vista Party)

External Vice President of Statewide Affairs: Mayela Morales (Isla Vista Party)

External Vice President of Local Affairs: Jeike Meijer (Isla Vista Party)

Student Advocate General: Grecia Martinez (Independent)

  1. Zion Solomon (Isla Vista Party)
  2. Yasamin Salari (Isla Vista Party)
  3. Melissa Perez (Isla Vista Party)
  4. Lea Toubian (Campus United)
  5. Yash Nagpal (Campus United)

University-Owned Housing Senator (One Seat):

  • Food Bank: 90.21% yes

  • NewCen: 81.69% no

articles.title: Vista Point: Freebies and Activities in Isla Vista
articles.description: Whether you need community service hours or just want to help out those around you, head to the El Dorado community lounge this Saturday morning at 9:30 a.m. The University Undergrad Apartments will b...
articles.content:
Sierra Deak / Daily Nexus

I.V. DILFS AND MILFS

Can’t have the weekend without some live music! Idle Riot will be playing this Friday night, with Fencer opening for them at 9 p.m. The theme of the night is “Dilfs and Milfs,” so attendees are urged to dress up as their favorite “dilf/milf.” Both are rock bands; Idle Riot is based in Isla Vista, while Fencer will be coming up from L.A. to perform. The show will be held at 6610 Del Playa Drive.

 

FIND MEANING IN GLEANING

If you’re like me, you’ve never heard the term gleaning before; gleaning is a term that means picking produce from harvest that would otherwise be unpicked and perish. Join Zero Waste Committee, FoodCycling and Environmental Affairs Board for their first gleaning event of the quarter this Saturday from 8 a.m. to 11:30 a.m. They will be taking students to glean in the Montecito community. Carpooling will be arranged. Those interested can sign up at tinyurl.com/UCSBGleaning.

 

HELP THE HOMELESS

Whether you need community service hours or just want to help out those around you, head to the El Dorado community lounge this Saturday morning at 9:30 a.m. The University Undergrad Apartments will be putting together care packages for houseless individuals. A light breakfast will be provided.

 

HIKE TO THE SEVEN FALLS

Stretch your legs with Environmental Affairs Board on a hike to Seven Falls this Sunday from 9 a.m. to 12:30 p.m. The trail is one of the easier hikes, spanning three miles and multiple waterfalls. Depending on conditions, there may even be a natural waterslide, WHAT????!!!! Organizers ask that those interested in participating fill out a short Google form that can be found on the event page. Go have fun!

 

YA LIKE BRUNCH? YA LIKE YOGA?

Grab your yoga mat and head over to the Isla Vista Food Cooperative at 9:45 a.m. this Sunday for their monthly event, Beach Brunch Yoga. The event includes an hour-long yoga class on the bluffs overlooking the ocean followed by a light brunch. This month, the brunch will be set up as a “build a bowl” where participants can create an açai bowl with granola and superfood toppings. The brunch theme will vary each month of the year. Participants must pay a $5 fee at the Co-Op from 8 a.m. to 10 p.m. any day before the event to sign up. Those who do not show up on time at 10 a.m. may lose their spot unless they call ahead of time.

A version of this article appeared on p.3 of the April 26 print edition of the Daily Nexus.

Print
